description: From Latin plausibilis (“deserving applause, praiseworthy, acceptable, pleasing”), from the participle stem of plaudere (“to applaud”).

adjectives.description: plausible (comparative more plausible, superlative most plausible)

entries.meaning: Seemingly or apparently valid, likely, or acceptable; conceivably true or likely.
Obtaining approbation; specifically pleasing; apparently right; specious.
examples: a plausible pretext; plausible manners; a plausible delusion

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Worthy of being applauded; praiseworthy; commendable; ready.
